questions.uddipok:
Change the sentences according to directions.

(a) Jackfruit is one of the largest fruits of Bangladesh. (Use Positive degree)

(b) The fruit is very juicy. (Make an Exclamatory sentence)

(c) It tastes very sweet. (Use Passive voice)

(d) It contains high calories. (Make Negative sentence)

(e) Everyone knows it as our national fruit. (Interrogative)

(f) In summer, this fruit is very available. (Negative)

(g) It is mainly found in the month of Jaishtha. (Use Active voice)

(h) It is not as costly as the mango. (Use Comparative degree)

(i) We should eat the fruit to ensure nutrition. (Make an Imperative sentence)

(j) How beautiful jaçkfruits look in the trees! (Make Assertive).

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) Very few fruits of Bangladesh are as large as jackfruit.

(b) How juicy the fruit is!

(c) It is very sweet when it is tasted.

(d) It does not contain low calories.

(e) Who does not know it as our national fruit?

(f) In summer, this fruit is not very rare.

(g) We/People find it mainly in the month of Jaistha.

(h) It is cheaper than mango./Mango is costlier than it.

(i) Let's eat the fruit to ensure nutrition.

(j) Jackfruits look very beautiful in the trees.

The Headmaster Khulna Zilla School Khulna
Subject: Request for Increasing Common Room Facilities
Dear Sir,
On behalf of the students of our school, I would like to bring to your kind attention the inadequate facilities in our school’s common room. As you are aware, the common room is a vital space for students to refresh their minds and engage in recreational activities during breaks. However, the current setup is insufficient to meet the increasing needs of the students.
The common room lacks adequate seating arrangements, indoor game facilities, and updated newspapers and magazines. During recess, it becomes overcrowded, leaving many students without the opportunity to utilize the space effectively. This has a negative impact on our relaxation time, which is essential for maintaining focus and productivity in classes.
We humbly request your kind intervention to enhance the facilities in the common room by providing more chairs and tables, introducing additional indoor games like carrom and chess, and ensuring a regular supply of updated reading materials. These improvements would greatly contribute to the overall well-being and academic performance of the students.
We are hopeful for your understanding and prompt action in this regard.
Thank you for considering our request.
Yours faithfully,
Sumona Akter On behalf of the students Khulna Zilla School

questions.uddipok: Write a paragraph about 'A Winter Morning'.

sub_questions.explanation:
A Winter Morning
A winter morning is cold and foggy. Everrything seems hazy and indistinct. Grasses are wet with dew drops. However, when the sun rises, dew drops sparkle like pearls. Old people and children shiver in cold, Poor people gather straw and make fire to bask in the heat, Animals, too, are helpless. They hide themselvés in the corner of the house and try to save themselves from the biting cold outside. People get up late in the morning. Elderly people and children usually get up a bit late to evade cold of the early moming. Working people go out when the fog disappears and the sun seems brighter. People somettimes eat homemade cakes with 'date juice' and enjoy the warmth of the early sun while sitting outside their homes. Bangalees settled abroad, make it a poirit to return and spend the winter in Bangladesh. They find the winter here pleasant as the winter in any European country is tremendously. cold. A winter morning in Bangladesh is thus quite fascinating for them. My personal feeling about a winter morning is that it is a bane for the poor but a boon for the rich.
